author: newweiv
content: i see. thank you. this might not be possible, but what if i created my own wallet, and sent a transaction with nonce 3, skipping 1 and 2. Then I generated thousands of transactions, with nonces 3, 4, 5, 6,...etc. and sent them to the network. Based on my understanding of nonces, they are not part of account state and are generated dynamically and keep track of an accounts confirmed txs. Also, they establish an order to transactions, in that if nonce n-1 is not confirmed, then tx with nonce n will not be. so since i didn't create tx with nonce 1 and 2, then will these just sit in the network and take up resources?

author: newweiv
content: wait the above is flawed cuz wallets don't decide nonces, its calculated dynamically by clients counting the number of confirmed tx from an account

author: newweiv
content: wait so what if i sent a tx with 0 gas price, and this will probably not be included in a block for awhile (idk how long). then i spammed a few thousand transactions, all with 0 gas. they would just sit in the miners tx pools, right? is there some way to mitigate this, perhaps clients have some rule to drop tx after some time?
